subject: Law
title: Utilitarianism and the Law
description: Learn Utilitarianism and the Law in one minute.

hook.text: The greatest good for the greatest number. Sounds fairâ€”until the minority pays the price.

buildup.text: Utilitarianism judges laws by their consequences: the best law maximizes overall happiness or well-being.

discovery.text: Jeremy Bentham applied it to law: punishment should be just enough to deter, calculated by pleasure and pain.

twist.text: Utilitarianism can justify sacrificing individual rights if it benefits the majority. That's its fatal flaw.

climax.text: Cost-benefit analysis in regulation is utilitarian in spirit: weigh the costs of a rule against its benefits.

punchline.text: Maximizing happiness sounds right. Whose happiness matters is the hard part.

quiz.question: What is the main criticism of utilitarianism in law?
options: It can justify sacrificing individual rights for the majority
It doesn't apply to modern laws
